channel.title: Vps question
channel.description:
hi guys,
how many gb of RAM should a vps need to be, if you want to host a 562/659 server with 100 players. and does anyone know a good site where to get one?
thanks,
startcode

item.title: Vps question
item.dc:creator: @eballer48 eballer48
item.description:
@eballer48 wrote:

First of all 562 = fail. Second vpsland suck… wooservers.com is where it’s at. Third I doubt you have 100 players online constantly.

Read full topic

item.title: Vps question
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

[quote=“TurmoilFtwFtw, post:2, topic:413790”]562 server. has 100 Players U want windows 2008 64 bit maby 5gb of ram.

Jaguarpc – 27 Sep 17

VPSLand Merges with JaguarPC - Jaguarpc

What You Can Expect During the Transition First and foremost, all of your servers will remain untouched and online. The merger between VPSLand and JaguarPC will only affect the billing side of your VPSLand account. Instead of logging in at VPSLand,...

Will be pricy.[/quote]

You don’t need windows. Linux is cheaper, and will actually perform BETTER. If you program the server right you could get by on 4gb of RAM. The deciding factor is going to be connection speed. You want a fast line to be able to support everyone with little to no lagg.

VPSLand is very overpriced too. Just shop around and you should find some that are better. I tend to find that the ones who advertise that they support botting, will give you a better deal, and at a cheaper price. If you look around on the RSBuddy forum you should find a few that should support your needs, and will be 50%+ cheaper than VPSLand.

RSXVPS and VPSInfinity are two of the better ones I’ve seen.

Read full topic
